author: bradthechimera.bsky.social
text: Nine years ago I came to New York City for a last-ditch clinical trial at Memorial Sloan Kettering to cure my post-transplant lymphoma. I was blind and still very sick. This year I’m in NYC to see the sights, play chess, and promote my new novel. How many blessings can one person count?

author: kungat108.bsky.social
text: When I had the blessed 🙌 7 hour work day & a 9 minute commute on the 🚌 & 3 weeks vakay & 10 sick days & 4 personal days & the ability to accrue comp time for every 15 mins. over 7 hrs & a Union & a pension & a 457-plan & a Civil Service title & $100,000 salary, going to work at NYC DDC was such a

text: I’m guessing a lot of people felt sick to their stomach’s when they watched “ America’s Mayor” align himself with The biggest Con to ever come out of NYC

author: egplntparm.bsky.social
text: We just keep doing it. Thursday was 2+ hour rush hour drive from our home in Central Jersey to Weill Cornell, NYC, with a very sick guy. At least when we get there, they already know he’s coming and he gets attention right away. He even moved to a room within a few hours.

author: kittykat870.bsky.social
text: Housing, childcare, healthcare, food, along with every humane thing to give people a chance to thrive. Why should our brothers have to go without the basics of life to make the rich, richer? I am so sick of it. If Mamdani can do it in NYC, we can do it nationwide, like every other modern country.

author: a-ninja-magpie.bsky.social
text: Heartily sick of NYC mayor but weirdly, always happy to hear about Chicago Pope

author: griffongrizzly.bsky.social
text: I'm sick of so-called lefties who rooted for Zohran Mamdani in the NYC mayoral election, only to then clutch their pearls as soon as he speaks pragmatically. Pick the fights you can win.

author: oldandcranky.bsky.social
text: I got so much done today! I’m an actual grownup!! Worried about sick friend in NYC -send good vibes in the general direction of Queens. I love this person a lot. My kids call him uncle G. I’ve known him since 1968.

author: monaburns.bsky.social
text:
From 'kang' on Twitter tonight:
"lol JD has to be sick. It’s not fair. He tries so hard and this rich kid from NYC just walks in and smiles"

author: zzyzx.bsky.social
text:
Just bought all of my NYE travel tickets. 

Into NYC on 12/26, 2 nights in Brooklyn, switching to the travel plan hotel on 12/28, Mel flies home on 1/1, I visit my mom for a week, train it to Philly on 1/8, go to the game, fly home on the 9th

Better get my flu/covid boosters!

author: ylepidemiologist.bsky.social
text: ​​2/ Flu is surging. Statewide, cases jumped to 78% and hospitalizations rose 53%. In NYC, emergency department visits rose 104%. We spoke about it on Tuesday, but there's a new flu mutation that may make this season tougher. Getting a flu vaccination remains our best protection.

author: thecovidinfoguy.bsky.social
text:
nychealthy @nychealthy.bsky.social 

Wearing a mask in crowded indoor settings this fall can protect you and others from COVID-19, flu, and RSV, even if you don’t have symptoms. Well-fitting masks, like N95s, KN95s, or KF94s provide the best protection: www.nyc.gov/site/doh/cov...

author: realqrampage.fightins.online
text: I just also can’t take it seriously from anyone who was not masking prior to 2020, as I remember wearing masks on the subway in NYC when I moved there in 2013 (because I am Asian and that’s what I was taught for cold/flu season), and let me tell you, people were fucking rude/racist about it

author: tjradcliffe.bsky.social
text: "The best... health department in the world was now run by a man with no belief in modern scientific medicine and whose ambitions were not in public health but in politics."--from "The Great Influenza" by John M Barry, describing the situation in NYC just as the 1918 flu hit, and across the US today

author: alisonborealis.bsky.social
text:
I had this exact experience with bronchitis... and I COULD NOT explain to my mom well enough that I needed sleep if I was going to manage to do anything the day after.

It was, of course (it's always like this) during the H5N1 swine flu outbreak in NYC and I terrified passengers on the plane home.

author: ylepidemiologist.bsky.social
text: 7/ Finally, we have our infectious disease update. New York State and NYC have updated virus dashboards to show which respiratory illnesses are ramping up. Covid-19 is decreasing for now, but flu and RSV are rising across the state, with infants and toddlers seeing the highest rates.

author: politico.com
text:
Canadian officials ordered more than 300 ostriches killed amid an avian flu outbreak.

The farmers refused, sparking a legal and political fight involving a NYC grocery magnate and Dr. Oz.

How a flock of Canadian ostriches became a favorite MAHA cause 👇

author: thesasha.bsky.social
text: I went voting early even though it is farther away because there were special halloweenAND special early voting stickers in nYC this year and. I llove free stickers. (I also got a kids vaccination sticker with my Covid and flu shot!)
